In a way, yes. When a 3 dimensional being travel through time, they need to either move through a 4 dimensional coordinate (timeline or temporal coordinate) or 5th (alternate timeline), while still retaining their original dimensionality. A 3 dimensional can’t become a 4th dimensional, but could have the ability of a 4th dimensional; travelling freely through time, though in our case we can’t travel freely. Now, think of it like this. If a 2 dimensional drawing were to travel through 3 dimensional space, it move through the x, y, and z axis; a 3 dimensional space. Though they won’t be able to see nor interact with the z axis, they’d travel through it anyway and the x or y axis gives the necessary details for them to know that they’re indeed moving (e.g changing line patterns, cause 2 dimensionals could only see lines; they lack width or z axis.) The same with us 3 dimensional beings. If we move through time, we can’t see the t (time) axis, but we knpw that we’re moving through time by seeing the movement of things in the universe. Time is a framework for any movement to happen after all. If the movement of an object goes backward or fast forwards, then we’ll know we’re travelling in time at a different ‘speed’ than the others.
